entry.title: When are symmetric ideals monomial?
entry.summary: We study conditions under which an ideal generated by the orbits of polynomials for the symmetric group action becomes a monomial ideal. If the generators are homogeneous, we expect that such an ideal has a monomial radical if the coefficients of the generators are sufficiently general. We prove this in the case where some generator contains some power of a variable. Moreover, if the generators have only square-free terms and their coefficients do not sum to zero, we show that in a larger polynomial ring the ideal itself is square-free monomial. This has implications also for ideals of the infinite polynomial ring invariant under the symmetric group action.
